meanings.definition: Make or become black in color.
meanings.sent1: The fire blackened the wood in the fireplace.
meanings.sent2: The sun blackened the skin of the beachgoers.
meanings.sent3: The naughty children blackened their names by drawing on the walls.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds blackened the sky, signaling an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The ink blackened the paper, leaving a permanent mark.

meanings.definition: Cook (meat or fish) with a spicy crust on the outside.
meanings.sent1: The chef blackened the salmon on the grill.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant served blackened catfish with a side of rice.
meanings.sent3: The barbecue competition featured chefs blackening their best dishes.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of blackened spices filled the kitchen during dinner preparation.
meanings.sent5: The sizzle of the blackened steak on the hot pan was music to the cook's ears.
